Detailed Description

An extension to vk::Image that supports ownership of the memory and the view.

Note
Instances can be moved, but cannot be copied.

Warning
A std::runtime_error is thrown if the image cannot be created and allocated
Todo:
"... you're not supposed to actually call vkAllocateMemory for every individual image. ... The right way to allocate memory for a large number of objects at the same time is to create a custom allocator that splits up a single allocation among many different objects by using the offset parameters that we've seen in many functions."

Member Function Documentation

◆ computeMaxMipLevels()

uint32_t Vkx::Image::computeMaxMipLevels ( uint32_t  width,
uint32_t  height 
)
static

Returns the maximum number of mip levels needed for the given with and height.

This function returns the number of mip levels needed to reach a 1x1 texture, assuming that the values are integers and the length of a side is computed as: Lengthi = Lengthi-1 > 1 ? Lengthi-1 / 2 : 1.

Parameters
widthWidth of the image
heightHeight of the image
Returns
number of levels
